All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Innovative Chemical Technologies, Inc.

Executive Summary

EPA Risk Management Plan

It is the policy of Innovative Chemical Technologies, Inc.  to plan, construct, and operate processes in a manner to prevent accidental releases of hazardous materials.  The emergency response policy is to protect employees, local citizens, and the environment by determining the potential for accidental release and providing, where possible, effective mitigation measures, employee training, and responder training and familiarization.  Additionally, the company is committed to review policies and procedures periodically or whenever warranted for cause.

The stationary source for which this plan is created and maintained is a bulk storage tank containing formalin and carbon disulfide.  The equipment employed for the purpose of receiving and storing formalin and carbon disulfide prior to use is specifically designed and constructed to eliminate release in any quantity.  Regular inspections are carried out along with required maintenance by employees trained in these operations under controlled conditions using written procedures.

Mitigation of potential releases of formalin and carbon disulfide was included in the design and construction of equipment used to receive and store formalin and carbon disulfide.  Containment, blanketing, fire suppression, pressure, and level control devices are integrated into the systems.

Operations involving receiving and storage of formalin and carbon disulfide are conducted using carefully written and critically reviewed operating instructions by employees trained in the safe accomplishment of their assigned tasks.  Periodic refresher training is provided.

There have been no accidents involving formalin and carbon disulfide at this facility within the past five years.

Innovative Chemical Technologies, Inc. has created and maintained a comprehensive Integrated Contingency Plan in order to provide a single document to provide guidance in the event of a

n accident or release of materials.  This document is reviewed regularly and used for training purposes as well as to provide familiarization to local first responders.  Regular tours and familiarization meetings are conducted with members of the Cartersville Fire Department.  This document provides guidance to employees as well as critical information to incident responders.

There are no critical updates to the equipment or processes covered under the EPA Risk Management regulations planned as of this writing.
